sailpoint.integration

Class AuthenticationUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.integration.AuthenticationUtil

  • public class AuthenticationUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility to help perform authentication for REST requests.

    • Field Detail

      • PARAM_AUTHN_USER

        public static final java.lang.String PARAM_AUTHN_USER
        Argument that can be used to specify username for authentication. Consulted if an "Authorization" header is not found. This is assumed to be in clear text.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PARAM_AUTHN_PASSWORD

        public static final java.lang.String PARAM_AUTHN_PASSWORD
        Argument that can be used to specify password for authentication. Consulted if an "Authorization" header is not found. This is assumed to be in clear text.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public AuthenticationUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • getCredentials

        public static java.lang.String[] getCredentials(java.lang.String authHeader,
                                                java.lang.String authnUserParam,
                                                java.lang.String authnPasswordParam)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Return the credentials pulled from the request in a two-element String array with the first element being the username and the second element being the password. These are pulled from the given Authorization header if present, or special request parameters. We assume that this is basic auth and that the format is "Basic user:pass" where user:pass is base64 encoded.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • decodeHeader

        public static java.lang.String[] decodeHeader(java.lang.String authMethod,
                                              java.lang.String regExSeparator,
                                              java.lang.String authHeader)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Base64 decodes the Authorization Header, after stripping the authentication method. Once stripped, will split the string based on some separator into two parts. Presumably those would be username and password. For an encoded string "Basic user:pass" parameters are ("Basic", ":", authHeader).
        Parameters:
        authMethod - "Basic", "Bearer" or otherwise
        regExSeparator - separator to split the decoded authHeader
        authHeader - the header to act on
        Returns:
        String['part1','part2'] or 'user','pass' for Basic auth
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isBasicAuth

        public static boolean isBasicAuth(java.lang.String authHeader)
        If the Authorization header doesn't start with "Basic", then this is not basic authorization.
        Parameters:
        authHeader -
        Returns:
        true if "Basic " is at the beginning of the provided string

      • isBearerAuth

        public static boolean isBearerAuth(java.lang.String authHeader)
        If the Authorization header doesn't start with "Bearer", then this is not bearer authorization.
        Parameters:
        authHeader -
        Returns:
        true if "Bearer " is at the beginning of the provided string
